Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
About the role:

As a Data Analyst, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate closely with our dynamic teams and working on multiple tasks. You will play an important role in creating engaging and insightful data visualizations using Tableau, using advanced data analysis and modelling techniques to find valuable trends and patterns within our datasets. Your involvement in developing and maintaining data models, reports, and workflows will be crucial to our success. Furthermore, you will actively engage with various business units, gaining a deep understanding of their unique needs and creating customized dashboards and solutions to meet and exceed their expectations.




About the project:

Duration: 2-3 months

The project contains 2 parts of development:

The backend (data warehouse ) using the in-house data centre to develop a solution from data collocation to structured database (in storge ) ,
The frontend (visualisation ) : using the structured database in storge with the Tableau we cerate advance models flows in addition to build the dashboard visualizations.




What are the expectations/requirements?

You are already based in the Netherlands

Re-creation of existing dashboard and visualizations from PowerBI to tableau.

Creating data models from database using tableau Prep for visualizations

Creating new deep dives upon request

Interacting with multiple stakeholders to understand their requirements and implementing them in their dashboards

Gaid and support the stakeholders to understand and unlock the potential dashboard

Creating appealing dashboards and visualization, knowledge of UXUI would be nice




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the data solutions team to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions
Create interactive and insightful data visualizations using Tableau
Perform complex data analysis and modelling to uncover trends, patterns, and insights using Tableau prep and SQL.
Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Discuss with business units (clients) to understand their needs and create dashboards tailored to their expectations
Contribute to the documentation of processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and project planning activities




Want to know more about us?

We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. We do not know what the future is going to look like, but we definitely have the opportunity to shape it. To do so we are and act trustworthy, committed and curious.

Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.

Title: Data Analyst - Tableau Expert
Description:
Role Details

Data Analyst - Tableau Specialist
Day rate contract
Hybrid working – 4 days onsite in Dublin




Job Scope:

This role would be ideal for someone who enjoys working at the intersection of business and technology, using advanced data visualization tools to enable decision-making while also being comfortable with technical tasks like data modeling and SQL querying. The ability to communicate effectively with senior leadership is critical, as is the flexibility to adapt dashboards and reports to changing business requirements




Primary Responsibilities:




Business Analysis:

Lead projects like the Asset Catalog, working with the Infrastructure Data Engineering team.
Gather, translate, and document business requirements, ensuring they align with technical capabilities.
Collaborate with senior stakeholders to identify their needs and provide analytical solutions.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership in a clear and actionable format.

Tableau Development:

Design, develop, and maintain complex Tableau dashboards to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Translate business requirements into visualizations that provide actionable insights.
Continuously optimize and enhance Tableau dashboards and reports to meet evolving business needs.

Data Engineering:

Support data engineering tasks such as refining data models to ensure they meet the needs of the visualizations.
Work with large datasets using SQL, and perform data manipulations as necessary to support dashboard development.

Key Skills and Experience:

Tableau Expertise: Advanced knowledge of Tableau, including dashboard creation, data modelling, and creating sophisticated visualizations.
Business Analysis: Proven experience in gathering and translating business requirements into technical solutions.
SQL Proficiency: Strong SQL skills for data manipulation and querying large datasets.
Stakeholder Management: Experience working with senior stakeholders and translating business needs into technical solutions.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with a high level of attention to detail.




This is a day rate contract role. Please apply if you satisfy the criteria above.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us
Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.

Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.

We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.

We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.

The Role:
As a Junior Data Analyst on our Partnerships and Affiliate Marketing team, you will play a critical role in supporting the success of our affiliate programs and partnerships. We are looking for someone who takes initiative, actively seeks out opportunities for improvement, and is eager to contribute to our team’s success.

In this Role, your responsibilities will include:

* Monitor and Analyze Performance: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) across various channels, identifying trends, and communicating to the team any anomalies, and opportunities for optimization.
* Generate Insights for Campaign Optimization: Assist in analyzing data to provide insights that help improve campaign performance, ROI, and overall marketing effectiveness.
* Develop and Maintain Dashboards: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of dashboards that provide real-time insights into program performance, making it easy for stakeholders to understand key metrics and trends.
* Support Partnership Strategies: Work with business developers and learn about the effectiveness of different partnerships, contributing data-driven recommendations for future collaborations.
* Take Initiative in Problem-Solving: Proactively identify issues or opportunities for optimization and develop strategies that improve overall performance.
* Collaborate Internationally: Work alongside marketing teams based in Shanghai and other global locations, ensuring that efforts align with broader marketing strategies and global business goals.
* Assist in Conducting Experiments: Support the design and analysis of experiments to test new strategies, creatives, or partnership models, contributing to data-driven decisions.

What you'll Need to Succeed:

* Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
* Communication Skills: Ability to translate data findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Basic SQL Knowledge: Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing datasets is preferred, with a willingness to develop these skills further.
* Experience with Data Analysis Tools: Strong skills in Excel or Google Sheets, including functions, data manipulation, and pivot tables. Experience with tools like Python, R, or BigQuery is a plus, offering opportunities to engage in more complex data analysis and automation.
* Basic Data Visualization Experience: Familiarity with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating dashboards and visual reports, with opportunities to develop proficiency.
* Interest in Partnerships and Affiliates: A strong curiosity and willingness to learn about affiliate marketing and partnership strategies, and how different factors affect our KPIs.
* Proactive, Collaborative, and Solution-Oriented: A self-starter who takes initiative in identifying opportunities for improvement and optimization. You enjoy developing solutions and contributing to projects, while also working collaboratively with cross-functional teams across different regions to achieve shared goals.

Why Trip.com Group
We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.
What’s more?

* Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions

* Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact

* We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.

* We encourage flexible work arrangement

* Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.

Click[1] the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?

Click [2] the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!

Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com

Have a good trip, and see you soon!


References

Visible links
1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w4D31J3atps
2. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQSUxvFTyqM

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into an Analytics Manager within the Product Development team you will focus on data analyses. Leading and working with the team, you will blend mathematical, analytical, and spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and analyzing data to deliver main Marketing Services products.

What you'll do?


Support shaping and refinement of projects.
Deliver projects
Provide mentoring to Analysts in the team.
Ensure knowledge transfer of analysis (interpretation; justification; methods).
Be an escalation point for analysts to support their work.
Ensure all work is process checked and sense checked following team checking guidelines.


Qualifications

What you'll bring:


Degree with high mathematical / technical / analytical content.
Experienced user of at least one analytical program, such as Python, Alteryx or WPS/SAS.
Proficient in the use of MS excel (can perform complex functions).
Experience interpreting analysis outputs, providing insight and making recommendations.
Proficient in advanced analytical methods, such as modelling and segmentation.


Desirable


Knowledge of any of the following programs / languages; SAS, Alteryx, R, SPSS, VBA, SQL, WPS, ArcGIS, or Python.


Additional Information

What you will get:


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here


Show more

We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into an Analytics Manager within the Product Development team you will focus on data analyses. Leading and working with the team, you will blend mathematical, analytical, and spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and analyzing data to deliver main Marketing Services products.

What you'll do?

  • Support shaping and refinement of projects.
  • Deliver projects
  • Provide mentoring to Analysts in the team.
  • Ensure knowledge transfer of analysis (interpretation; justification; methods).
  • Be an escalation point for analysts to support their work.
  • Ensure all work is process checked and sense checked following team checking guidelines.

Qualifications

What you'll bring:

  • Degree with high mathematical / technical / analytical content.
  • Experienced user of at least one analytical program, such as Python, Alteryx or WPS/SAS.
  • Proficient in the use of MS excel (can perform complex functions).
  • Experience interpreting analysis outputs, providing insight and making recommendations.
  • Proficient in advanced analytical methods, such as modelling and segmentation.

Desirable

  • Knowledge of any of the following programs / languages; SAS, Alteryx, R, SPSS, VBA, SQL, WPS, ArcGIS, or Python.

Additional Information

What you will get:

  • Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
  • Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
  • Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
  • Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
  • Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books.

Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Junior Data Entry Analyst
Description:
The role is part of the Global Account Services Signer Transformation Team and is responsible for driving the strategic development of the Account Services Offering to our global clients.

The individual will be responsible for ensuring there are appropriate focus, traction and progress in delivering this key transformation initiatives.

Key responsibilities


Populate daily tracker
Carry out manual data extraction and transposition of data for all non structured signers
Depending on complexity, if there are scope rules Project Ops will complete the Scope Rule validation and Scope manual extraction where possible
Carry Out Rule Validation Activity for rules created by Technology within the required timeframe
Issue Log to be updated
Progress, issues and defects to be socialized between the teams
Carry out manual remediation


Knowledge/Experience:


Experience of work in a process driven environment
You speak English at communicative level
You are good at excel
You have attention to detail, are responsible and learn quickly
You are open to new experiences and development within a global company
You work well within a team and can cooperate with others


What we offer:


Competitive salary connected with annual salary review and discretionary annual performance bonus;
Social benefits (private healthcare, award winning pension scheme, multisport, life insurance, holiday allowance, anniversary program, competitive maternity and paternity scheme);
Hybrid model of work – from modern offices and from home, flexible working hours;
Working in a friendly, dynamic, supportive and diverse environment – including multiple affinity and social networks & voluntary activities to engage with;
Structured onboarding process and extensive training offering (e.g. including Udemy, Degreed);
Opportunity to have an influence on the way you perform your tasks - our teams are constantly looking for new and better ways and we encourage all improvement ideas;
Unlimited development opportunities within Citi global network;
Exposure to a wide range of internal stakeholders as well as to senior management.


------------------------------------------------------

Job Family Group:

Customer Service

------------------------------------------------------

Job Family:

Institutional Client Onboarding

------------------------------------------------------

Time Type:

Full time

------------------------------------------------------

Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
⭐ 𝐓𝐮 𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐮 𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐞𝐭 𝐚̀ 𝐚𝐯𝐨𝐢𝐫 𝐮𝐧 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐬𝐮𝐫 𝐥𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐞 𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐜𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐚𝐢𝐫𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐧 𝐅𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 ?




💥 𝐓𝐮 𝐬𝐨𝐮𝐡𝐚𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐬 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐬 𝐮𝐧 𝐞𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐥𝐞, 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐞𝐭 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐞𝐧 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐞 ?







Alors notre entreprise, 𝐂𝐫𝐞́𝐝𝐢𝐭 𝐀𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐞 𝐓𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐒𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, pourrait te correspondre !




𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 ? Nous fabriquons les outils informatiques des conseillers bancaires et de nos clients du réseau bancaire des Caisses Régionales du groupe Crédit Agricole.




𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞 ? Nous continuerons, 𝐚𝐯𝐞𝐜 𝐭𝐨𝐢 𝐞𝐭 𝐧𝐨𝐬 𝟏𝟖𝟓𝟎 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐮𝐫𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, à « 𝑓𝑎𝑖𝑟𝑒 𝑑𝑒 𝐶𝐴-𝑇𝑆, 𝑙'𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑒𝑢𝑟 𝐼𝑇 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒́𝑓𝑒́𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑒 𝑒𝑛 𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑚𝑒𝑠 𝑑𝑒 𝑝𝑒𝑟𝑓𝑜𝑟𝑚𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒, 𝑑𝑒 𝑡𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒 𝑒𝑡 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑝𝑜𝑛𝑠𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑒́ 𝑠𝑜𝑐𝑖𝑒́𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒 » avec comme objectif commun : la satisfaction client.




Quelle est ta contribution en tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre DATA 🌟 ?




En tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre Data, tu seras accueilli.e comme un véritable moteur à notre efficacité collective, au même titre que tous les membres du Chapitre.




Intégrant une communauté dynamique et experte de plus de 30 collaborateurs, tu auras un impact direct et mesurable sur les services autour de la Data destinés à nos Pôles Produits IT et nos collaborateurs en Caisses régionales.




En tant que spécialiste du traitement de la donnée, tu seras amené à extraire et exploiter les données métiers exposées, les restituer sous forme de Tableaux de Bords et d’en mener des analyses en lien fort avec les métiers concernés. Tu chercheras constamment à faciliter la prise de décision des métiers via la data ; véritable levier de création de valeur métier.




𝐓𝐮 𝐚𝐮𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐥’𝐨𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐞́ :







🚀 Participer à des projets excitants en couvrant des cas d’usages Data variés :




Contribuer à la mise en œuvre de cas d’usages Data sur des domaines et des enjeux métiers variés




Collaborer en transverse avec différentes Squads et ainsi des acteurs multiples




Echanger et améliorer les pratiques de Fabrication avec les autres membres du Chapitre du site de Lyon mais aussi ceux des autres sites France




🔍 D’apporter ton expertise d’analyse de la donnée pour répondre à des besoins métiers à forts enjeux bancaires :




En collaborant étroitement avec les Business Analystes afin d’identifier les besoins Data du métier grâce à des ateliers d’affinage




En collectant et exploitant les données pour les restituer sous forme d’indicateurs ou de Tableaux de bord, et ainsi contribuer et conduire les analyses Data mises en lien avec les problématiques métiers




En présentant les résultats aux équipes métiers




En étant un véritable référent et ambassadeur de la Data sur des sujets transverses




En véhiculant auprès des métiers le cadre de gouvernance Data (Data Management, Data Privacy…) de l’entreprise, en portant les messages et expertises autour du Digital




En contribuant à l’évolution des pratiques du Chapitre dans une logique d’amélioration continue




💻 D’utiliser et d’améliorer au quotidien nos outils et nos process d’analyses :




Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord via Microstrategy (sur des activités BI)




Calcul d’indicateurs via script SQL sur environnement Teradata (sur des activités BI) et intégration dans des pipelines de restitution normées




Mise en œuvre du Tracking sur les parcours utilisateurs et Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord pour restituer les données aux métier (sur des activités Parcours Digitaux) - Logiciel et solutions analytiques : Tag Commander, Piano Analytics, Cosmo Survey




Conduite des analyses marketing sur la base du tracking déployé et force de proposition sur les possibles optimisations lors de ces analyses.




Ta vie au sein de notre Equipe :




✅ Un environnement de travail axé sur la qualité et l’intelligence collective.




🌟 L’opportunité de favoriser le quotidien de nos conseillers en agence et la satisfaction de nos 21 millions de clients à travers la France.




👪 Un accueil personnalisé assuré par tes collègues en complément du management et des référents RH pour vous aider à maximiser votre potentiel




🧠 Des sessions collaboratives de brainstorming et de résolution de problèmes pour favoriser l'innovation




💬 Un accès continu à la connaissance grâce à un catalogue très riche de formations en savoir-faire et en savoir-être, des accès aux salons, conférences et événements (Devoxx, DevFest, Vivatech, Salon de la data et de l’IA, ..) pour rester à la pointe des dernières tendances et meilleures pratiques




🌟 Participer activement aux activités "d’innovation" via des ateliers d’idéation technique et par la mise en place de nouvelles pratiques agiles.




🧠 Nourrir ta curiosité et ta soif d'apprentissage dans un environnement qui encourage la croissance professionnelle.







Découvrez le site de Lyon







𝐂𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐩𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐚 𝐯𝐢𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐟𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐞𝐭 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 :




Nous te proposons :




🚀 De participer à l’évolution de CA-TS en matière de performance, de technologie et de responsabilité sociétale : participation aux projets d’entreprise, développement de la fabrication responsable, contribution à la diminution de notre empreinte carbone.




👥De rejoindre CATECHS : LA communauté des techs de CA-TS. Et y retrouver des Techtalks, des sérious games, du Mob Programming, de la veille techno…




👨‍💻 De prendre part à des projets agiles complexes et innovants, de bout en bout : volumétrie clients importante, diversité technologique et métier, relation étroite avec tous nos clients (Conseillers bancaires en Caisses Régionales, clients du Crédit Agricole)




🏦 D’évoluer dans un environnement alliant modernité (espaces agiles et de créativité, télétravail) et prônant la Qualité de Vie au Travail (équilibre vie professionnelle/vie personnelle, avantages parentalité, forfait mobilité durable)




👫 De faire partie d’une entreprise motrice sur la diversité et l’égalité (94/100 sur l’index égalité Femmes / Hommes qui évalue la politique en matière d’égalité salariale et promotion entre femmes et hommes.)




🌿 De rejoindre une entreprise labélisée numérique responsable qui participe aux enjeux de sobriété et d’inclusion numérique (par exemple l’écoconception et l’accessibilité numérique) qui sont au cœur de la fabrication




🧠 De continuer à développer tes compétences et connaissances, à être accompagné∙e ou accompagner à ton tour (formations, intégration, mentoring, mobilité interne, actions marque employeur)




⭐ De faire évoluer ta carrière professionnelle et t’investir durablement (mobilités interne et groupe).













𝐓𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐜̧𝐚, 𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐞 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 :




💻 D’être cadre au forfait en ayant de la flexibilité sur la gestion du temps de travail, tu pourras travailler à distance 2 jours par semaine.




🏖 De disposer, en moyenne chaque année, de 46 jours de congés, et un compte épargne temps pour vous reposer et faire ce que vous aimez chaque année.




👪 D’avoir la possibilité de recevoir un intéressement important en lien avec les résultats de CATS.




🚎🌿 D’avoir un remboursement à hauteur de 75% de tes transports en commun / une Prime mobilité verte de 500 euros par an.




💳 D’avoir accès à un restaurant d’entreprise, aux avantages bancaires et assurances du Groupe CA, un CSE compétitif ainsi que d’une excellente couverture santé pour prendre soin de vous et de votre famille.




💟 De participer au programme de l’arrondi sur salaire au bénéfice d’associations...







𝐀̀ 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐢 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐫𝐚 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐫𝐮𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 ?




- Un premier échange avec ta Talent acquisition Spécialiste Mélissa- 1h

- Un test technique + un second échange avec un ou une de nos expert.es - 1h

- Un dernier échange avec Marieke ta future Leader ! - 1h




« 𝑃𝑎𝑟𝑐𝑒 𝑞𝑢𝑒 𝑙𝑒 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑛𝑒 𝑑𝑜𝑖𝑡 𝑝𝑙𝑢𝑠 𝑒̂𝑡𝑟𝑒 𝑢𝑛 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑒𝑛 𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑟𝑒𝑝𝑟𝑖𝑠𝑒, 𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑠, 𝐶𝑟𝑒́𝑑𝑖𝑡 𝐴𝑔𝑟𝑖𝑐𝑜𝑙𝑒 𝑇𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒𝑠 𝑒𝑡 𝑆𝑒𝑟𝑣𝑖𝑐𝑒𝑠, 𝑎𝑣𝑜𝑛𝑠 𝑜𝑢𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑡 𝑛𝑜𝑠 𝑚𝑒́𝑡𝑖𝑒𝑟𝑠 𝑎̀ 𝑡𝑜𝑢𝑠 𝑙𝑒𝑠 𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑠, 𝑠𝑎𝑛𝑠 𝑒𝑥𝑐𝑒𝑝𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛.»

HTML:
⭐ 𝐓𝐮 𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐮 𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐞𝐭 𝐚̀ 𝐚𝐯𝐨𝐢𝐫 𝐮𝐧 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐬𝐮𝐫 𝐥𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐞 𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐜𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐚𝐢𝐫𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐧 𝐅𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 ?


💥 𝐓𝐮 𝐬𝐨𝐮𝐡𝐚𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐬 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐬 𝐮𝐧 𝐞𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐥𝐞, 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐞𝐭 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐞𝐧 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐞 ?



Alors notre entreprise, 𝐂𝐫𝐞́𝐝𝐢𝐭 𝐀𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐞 𝐓𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐒𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, pourrait te correspondre !


𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 ? Nous fabriquons les outils informatiques des conseillers bancaires et de nos clients du réseau bancaire des Caisses Régionales du groupe Crédit Agricole.


𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞 ? Nous continuerons, 𝐚𝐯𝐞𝐜 𝐭𝐨𝐢 𝐞𝐭 𝐧𝐨𝐬 𝟏𝟖𝟓𝟎 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐮𝐫𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, à « 𝑓𝑎𝑖𝑟𝑒 𝑑𝑒 𝐶𝐴-𝑇𝑆, 𝑙'𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑒𝑢𝑟 𝐼𝑇 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒́𝑓𝑒́𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑒 𝑒𝑛 𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑚𝑒𝑠 𝑑𝑒 𝑝𝑒𝑟𝑓𝑜𝑟𝑚𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒, 𝑑𝑒 𝑡𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒 𝑒𝑡 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑝𝑜𝑛𝑠𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑒́ 𝑠𝑜𝑐𝑖𝑒́𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒 » avec comme objectif commun : la satisfaction client.


Quelle est ta contribution en tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre DATA 🌟 ?


En tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre Data, tu seras accueilli.e comme un véritable moteur à notre efficacité collective, au même titre que tous les membres du Chapitre.


Intégrant une communauté dynamique et experte de plus de 30 collaborateurs, tu auras un impact direct et mesurable sur les services autour de la Data destinés à nos Pôles Produits IT et nos collaborateurs en Caisses régionales.


En tant que spécialiste du traitement de la donnée, tu seras amené à extraire et exploiter les données métiers exposées, les restituer sous forme de Tableaux de Bords et d’en mener des analyses en lien fort avec les métiers concernés. Tu chercheras constamment à faciliter la prise de décision des métiers via la data ; véritable levier de création de valeur métier.


𝐓𝐮 𝐚𝐮𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐥’𝐨𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐞́ :



🚀 Participer à des projets excitants en couvrant des cas d’usages Data variés :


  • Contribuer à la mise en œuvre de cas d’usages Data sur des domaines et des enjeux métiers variés


  • Collaborer en transverse avec différentes Squads et ainsi des acteurs multiples


  • Echanger et améliorer les pratiques de Fabrication avec les autres membres du Chapitre du site de Lyon mais aussi ceux des autres sites France


🔍 D’apporter ton expertise d’analyse de la donnée pour répondre à des besoins métiers à forts enjeux bancaires :


En collaborant étroitement avec les Business Analystes afin d’identifier les besoins Data du métier grâce à des ateliers d’affinage


En collectant et exploitant les données pour les restituer sous forme d’indicateurs ou de Tableaux de bord, et ainsi contribuer et conduire les analyses Data mises en lien avec les problématiques métiers


En présentant les résultats aux équipes métiers


En étant un véritable référent et ambassadeur de la Data sur des sujets transverses


En véhiculant auprès des métiers le cadre de gouvernance Data (Data Management, Data Privacy…) de l’entreprise, en portant les messages et expertises autour du Digital


En contribuant à l’évolution des pratiques du Chapitre dans une logique d’amélioration continue


💻 D’utiliser et d’améliorer au quotidien nos outils et nos process d’analyses :


  • Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord via Microstrategy (sur des activités BI)


  • Calcul d’indicateurs via script SQL sur environnement Teradata (sur des activités BI) et intégration dans des pipelines de restitution normées


  • Mise en œuvre du Tracking sur les parcours utilisateurs et Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord pour restituer les données aux métier (sur des activités Parcours Digitaux) - Logiciel et solutions analytiques : Tag Commander, Piano Analytics, Cosmo Survey


  • Conduite des analyses marketing sur la base du tracking déployé et force de proposition sur les possibles optimisations lors de ces analyses.


Ta vie au sein de notre Equipe :


✅ Un environnement de travail axé sur la qualité et l’intelligence collective.


🌟 L’opportunité de favoriser le quotidien de nos conseillers en agence et la satisfaction de nos 21 millions de clients à travers la France.


👪 Un accueil personnalisé assuré par tes collègues en complément du management et des référents RH pour vous aider à maximiser votre potentiel


🧠 Des sessions collaboratives de brainstorming et de résolution de problèmes pour favoriser l'innovation


💬 Un accès continu à la connaissance grâce à un catalogue très riche de formations en savoir-faire et en savoir-être, des accès aux salons, conférences et événements (Devoxx, DevFest, Vivatech, Salon de la data et de l’IA, ..) pour rester à la pointe des dernières tendances et meilleures pratiques


🌟 Participer activement aux activités "d’innovation" via des ateliers d’idéation technique et par la mise en place de nouvelles pratiques agiles.


🧠 Nourrir ta curiosité et ta soif d'apprentissage dans un environnement qui encourage la croissance professionnelle.



Découvrez le site de Lyon



𝐂𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐩𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐚 𝐯𝐢𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐟𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐞𝐭 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 :


Nous te proposons :


🚀 De participer à l’évolution de CA-TS en matière de performance, de technologie et de responsabilité sociétale : participation aux projets d’entreprise, développement de la fabrication responsable, contribution à la diminution de notre empreinte carbone.


👥De rejoindre CATECHS : LA communauté des techs de CA-TS. Et y retrouver des Techtalks, des sérious games, du Mob Programming, de la veille techno…


👨‍💻 De prendre part à des projets agiles complexes et innovants, de bout en bout : volumétrie clients importante, diversité technologique et métier, relation étroite avec tous nos clients (Conseillers bancaires en Caisses Régionales, clients du Crédit Agricole)


🏦 D’évoluer dans un environnement alliant modernité (espaces agiles et de créativité, télétravail) et prônant la Qualité de Vie au Travail (équilibre vie professionnelle/vie personnelle, avantages parentalité, forfait mobilité durable)


👫 De faire partie d’une entreprise motrice sur la diversité et l’égalité (94/100 sur l’index égalité Femmes / Hommes qui évalue la politique en matière d’égalité salariale et promotion entre femmes et hommes.)


🌿 De rejoindre une entreprise labélisée numérique responsable qui participe aux enjeux de sobriété et d’inclusion numérique (par exemple l’écoconception et l’accessibilité numérique) qui sont au cœur de la fabrication


🧠 De continuer à développer tes compétences et connaissances, à être accompagné∙e ou accompagner à ton tour (formations, intégration, mentoring, mobilité interne, actions marque employeur)


⭐ De faire évoluer ta carrière professionnelle et t’investir durablement (mobilités interne et groupe).





𝐓𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐜̧𝐚, 𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐞 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 :


💻 D’être cadre au forfait en ayant de la flexibilité sur la gestion du temps de travail, tu pourras travailler à distance 2 jours par semaine.


🏖 De disposer, en moyenne chaque année, de 46 jours de congés, et un compte épargne temps pour vous reposer et faire ce que vous aimez chaque année.


👪 D’avoir la possibilité de recevoir un intéressement important en lien avec les résultats de CATS.


🚎🌿 D’avoir un remboursement à hauteur de 75% de tes transports en commun / une Prime mobilité verte de 500 euros par an.


💳 D’avoir accès à un restaurant d’entreprise, aux avantages bancaires et assurances du Groupe CA, un CSE compétitif ainsi que d’une excellente couverture santé pour prendre soin de vous et de votre famille.


💟 De participer au programme de l’arrondi sur salaire au bénéfice d’associations...



𝐀̀ 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐢 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐫𝐚 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐫𝐮𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 ?


- Un premier échange avec ta Talent acquisition Spécialiste Mélissa- 1h

- Un test technique + un second échange avec un ou une de nos expert.es - 1h

- Un dernier échange avec Marieke ta future Leader ! - 1h


« 𝑃𝑎𝑟𝑐𝑒 𝑞𝑢𝑒 𝑙𝑒 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑛𝑒 𝑑𝑜𝑖𝑡 𝑝𝑙𝑢𝑠 𝑒̂𝑡𝑟𝑒 𝑢𝑛 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑒𝑛 𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑟𝑒𝑝𝑟𝑖𝑠𝑒, 𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑠, 𝐶𝑟𝑒́𝑑𝑖𝑡 𝐴𝑔𝑟𝑖𝑐𝑜𝑙𝑒 𝑇𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒𝑠 𝑒𝑡 𝑆𝑒𝑟𝑣𝑖𝑐𝑒𝑠, 𝑎𝑣𝑜𝑛𝑠 𝑜𝑢𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑡 𝑛𝑜𝑠 𝑚𝑒́𝑡𝑖𝑒𝑟𝑠 𝑎̀ 𝑡𝑜𝑢𝑠 𝑙𝑒𝑠 𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑠, 𝑠𝑎𝑛𝑠 𝑒𝑥𝑐𝑒𝑝𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛.»

Title: Analista de Datos
Description:
Estamos en búsqueda de un Data Analyst con ganas de superarse día a día para uno de nuestros clientes finales más importantes del sector de energías.




RESPONSABILIDADES:




Administrar y dar soporte con herramientas de consolidación e informes utilizadas en finanzas entorno PowerBI para su correcto diseño, construcción y mantenimiento.
Analizar los flujos de datos en toda la organización e identificar oportunidades de mejora, al tiempo que brindar soporte a las líneas de negocio para garantizar que el sistema satisfaga sus necesidades comerciales.
Contribuir con habilidades técnicas (SQL, Azure ADF, Python, RPA) a las iniciativas de automatización.
Brindar soporte a FP&A, Control y otros líderes funcionales con informes y análisis ad hoc.




HABILIDADES:




Graduado en Ingeniería, Matemáticas y Estadística + Máster relacionado en Data.
+2 años de experiencia trabajando como consultor implementando herramientas de informes o como administrador del sistema de informes.
Conocimientos avanzados en PowerBI.
Ser una persona analítica, con habilidades sólidas para resolver problemas y analizar errores, orientado a resultados y con un enfoque estructurado en el trabajo.
Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y asumir un rol de gestión práctico.
Curiosidad intelectual, alta motivación y deseo de mejora continua.
Inglés: mínimo un C1.




CONDICIONES:




Banda salarial: 35.000 - 40.000€
Beneficios flexibles: seguro de vida, seguro de salud y tickets restuarantes.
Modelo de trabajo: Híbrido, 1 día de teletrabajo.




¡Si te ha interesado y estás en ese punto que quieres hacer un cambio en tu trayectoría profesional este es tu momento, así que no lo dudes y aplica!

Title: Data Analyst (Analytics & Insights)
Description:
Job Location

Bucharest

Job Description

Would you like to harness the power of data to drive business results, through breakthrough analytics, business consulting and innovative data capabilities? Are you able to discover the story in all the noise and identify what really matters? Join us in this engaging journey!

The Analytics & Insights organization creates a point of difference for P&G. We directly influence business strategy, via deep consumer, retailer and market understanding, spanning from human insights to data science. We innovate every single day the way business is done, through advanced mathematical models, providing optimization algorithms and uncovering unexpected insights.

This role is within Analytics (IT). You will be the go-to-person on data analysis and big data application, with your deep understanding of and passion for data analysis and data science techniques, striking the tangent between consumer insights and advanced analytics to solve tough business problems as a strategic consultant to P&G leadership.

Your Responsibilities


Deliver insights by using advanced analytic techniques, mining extremely large data sets and applying best in class algorithms developed in partnership with other Data Scientists/ Analysts
Analyze Market & Share performance of our brands, to identify trends and root-causes
Forecast key growth opportunities and competitive threats to design new market strategies
Grow the organizations’ knowledge with analytic capabilities.


Job Qualifications


Bachelor or Master degree in: Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math, Statistics, Analytics etc.
Passionate about discovering new things, analyzing data or programming to deliver strong insights and strategic recommendations against defined business objectives.
Solid written, visual, and verbal communication skills. Excellent command of English.
Strong interpersonal skills, great priority-setting, self-motivated, collaborative, ‘can-do’ attitude.
Experience with data science programming languages and/or business analytics tools (SQL/R/Python/Power BI) is required, while previous knowledge of Big Data ecosystem (Hadoop, Azure) would be considered an asset.


Becoming part of P&G, you will benefit of


Competitive salary package, annual bonus, and vacation bonus
Private medical insurance & life insurance & 24 Hours Accident Insurance
Stock Ownership Plan - You have the opportunity to buy P&G shares quoted on the New York Stock Exchange to participate in the profits of the Company and the company will match part of the investments
Flexible working schedule & Hybrid Work from Home/Work from Office option
Meal allowance and access to our private canteen
Sports Program – will allow you to reimburse sport activities
Dental & Glasses Plan - will allow you to reimburse dental and ophthalmological care
Access to a variety of learning and development platforms
Employee Assistance Program – confidential expert guidance and specialist support on any work, wellbeing, emotional, financial, physical or family issue.


About Us

We produce globally recognized brands, and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ariel®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Herbal Essences®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide.

Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.

Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we’re committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion and our ideal candidate is passionate about the same principle: you will join our daily effort of being “in touch” so we craft brands and products to improve the lives of the world’s consumers now and in the future. We want you to inspire us with your unrivalled ideas.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000114637

Job Segmentation

Experienced Professionals (Job Segmentation)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Want to get ahead of the game?




We are actively seeking top talent to join our team and help drive our company's success.




As a member of our Data Analyst Talent Community, you will have the opportunity to:




Be first in line to be considered for future job openings within the company

Network with other highly skilled professionals in your field

Stay up-to-date on the latest industry trends and developments

Receive exclusive content from Randstad industry leading teams




We are searching for Data Analyst professionals to join our industry leading organization in The Netherlands and other European Countries to experience what it's like to work in a truly Human Forward company that puts people first, offering flexible working setups and highly competitive compensation, whilst also giving you the chance to grow and develop your skills to build for your best future.




If you're interested in learning more about advancing your career then please click to apply to join our Talent Pool...




We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to

complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for a curious, dynamic and creative graduate to join us as a Junior Data Analyst. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is truly an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

The Team and Role’s mission

Are you passionate about decoding shopper behaviour and using data to answer tough questions? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can directly impact business strategies?

By joining our Global Analytical Development Teams as a Junior Data Analyst at Kantar Worldpanel, you'll work with the richest consumer panel dataset in the world, helping global clients understand and predict shopper behaviour across various markets, including FMCG, Tech, Beauty, and Fashion. We expect you to develop expert level data wrangling skills in R, SQL and Python which you’ll be expected to apply to our disaggregated datasets to create analytic solutions as well as having to actively developing Power BI Dashboards to help us tailoring compelling stories to our clients.

You’ll also be able to evolve in a variety of ways – as some of our Data Analyst have gone on to become Data Scientists, Data Engineers or even Project Managers that take on and lead challenging projects. With us, you’ll have the opportunity to develop your skills depending on business requirements and your interests, you’ll be able to progress onto learning and working with Angular, Databricks, Spark, Docker or Kubernetes. You could end up building front-end applications which help tell stories that our global clients will use to build their business strategies; or even using modelling techniques such as regression, decision trees and clustering.

If you're ready to make a meaningful impact on a global scale, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Key outcomes


Support various data-related projects across different departments, by working with diverse data sets to clean, manipulate, and analyse data using tools such as R and Python.
Conduct thorough data quality checks and ensure the integrity of the data.
Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data.
Understand industry best practices for data modelling to organise the data behind Power BI reports.
Develop and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards in order to translate complex data sets into easy-to-understand visualizations for stakeholders.


Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…


University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or equivalent fields.
Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum Required).
Demonstrable experience with data analysis, either through academic coursework, projects, or internships.
Comfortable programming skills in R and/or Python will be required.
Experience or knowledge in SQL for database management and querying.
Familiarity with Power BI or other relevant data visualization tools.


With the following qualities…


A passionate learner willing to set aside hours each week to upskill yourself and progress quickly with the tools at your disposal.
Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.
Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably connect with partners at all levels across the organization and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.


What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...


1st Stage – Numerical Reasoning Assessment Test.
2nd Stage – Screening Interview with Talent Acquisition.
3rd Stage – Technical interview with Hiring Managers.


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.




We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.




Job Title: MI/Data Analyst




Job Description




Responsible for creations and amendment of performance reporting for Fiserv Operations team and clients.
Utilise data to highlight trends and opportunities, delivering key messages to leadership team to impact continuous improvement plans.
Maintain control framework around report/dashboard design and delivery, ensuring risk mitigation and consistent delivery of MI Suite.
Develop and maintain ETL data extraction packages, focused on flexible reporting for BI solution.
Develop new data sources to enrich existing customer interaction insight to support customer centric processes.




Scope of Job




Develop dashboards and reporting suite to analyse and inform business decisions. Adding personal insight to guide senior leader’s strategic roadmap.




Job Requirements




Relevant work experience considered an acceptable substitute for the education requirement.
Experience working with employee-based performance data, including standard deviation and other assessment methods.
Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, or Math qualification, preferred, not essential.
German speaker




Competencies




Measure Effectiveness of solutions
A high level of mathematical ability
The ability to analyse, model and interpret data
Problem-solving skills
Written and verbal communication skills
Accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to deliver multiple high priority projects simultaneously




What you should know about us:




Fiserv is a global leader in payments and financial technology with more than 40,000 associates proudly serving clients in more than 100 countries. As one of Fortune® magazine's "World's Most Admired Companies™" 9 of the last 10 years, one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, and a top scorer on Bloomberg’s Gender-Equality Index, we are committed to innovation and excellence.




Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:




We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Financial Services




We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst with a strong background in SQL, R, Python and Power BI to join a growing financial services organisation on a permanent basis.




The role will be responsible for transforming data into actionable insights, generating reports and developing visual dashboards to support business operations and strategic initiatives.




The ideal candidate will possess the ability to gather, analyse and interpret large datasets to support data driven decision-making processes.




The Role




Extract, clean, and manage large datasets from various data sources using SQL, R and Python.
Design and maintain efficient databases, ensuring data integrity and quality.
Work with the wider business teams to define data needs and requirements.
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, patterns and insights.
Use statistical methods and machine learning algorithms in R and Python to analyse data and forecast trends.
Design, build, and maintain data models to support reporting and analysis needs.
Create interactive and dynamic reports and dashboards using Power BI to present insights to stakeholders.
Translate complex data into easy-to-understand visualisations and presentations.
Monitor and maintain existing dashboards, ensuring accuracy and timely updates.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business challenges and provide actionable insights based on data analysis.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation using data insights.
Communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear and concise manner.




The Person




Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science or a related field.
6 years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying databases and manipulating large datasets.
Experience in R and Python for statistical analysis, machine learning and automation tasks.
Strong knowledge of Power BI for creating dashboards and data visualisations.
Familiarity with other data visualisation tools like Tableau or Excel.
Hands-on experience with database design, data warehousing and ETL processes.
Strong statistical and data modelling skills.
Ability to interpret complex datasets and provide actionable insights.
Strong problem-solving skills with an analytical mindset.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.




Contact David on david@kennedyandpartners.ie | 086 440 3623 for more information on this role or make an easy application through the link provided.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities




Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling




Requirements




Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
Excellent Excel skills
Advanced SQL skills
Good Power Query skills
Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
Strong spoken and written English

  • Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
  • In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling


Requirements


  • Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
  • Excellent Excel skills
  • Advanced SQL skills
  • Good Power Query skills
  • Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
  • Strong spoken and written English

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Accelerate your development and exposure to high performance applications and cloud infrastructure. Join Faptic Technology, a fast-growing scale-up organization with an ambition to be recognized as one of the leading technology companies in Romania.

Our global client base needs builders: engineers and developers who love technology, have deep expertise in software and cloud technologies, and importantly, have a passion for culture and customers.


We obsess about our customers
We build outstanding technical solutions
We create an awesome culture
We accelerate learning and careers


As a Junior Data Analyst, you will join a team who deals with cutting-edge technologies every day and strives to utilize integration services to their limits. You will be taking part in Solution and Architectural designs as well as introducing and proposing new methods and technologies through well tested Proof-of-Concepts. You will Design, develop and deploy pipelines, create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications. You will develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues.

Your activities will include:


Will be working with SQL databases
You will be mentored and have support in further learning and developing your technical skills
Analyze and translate functional specifications /user stories into technical specifications
Research and introduce new technologies and solutions
Implement Proof of Concepts and drive solutions through their full life-cycle
Design, develop and deploy pipelines
Create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications
Develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues
Participate in defining policies & procedures (cloud adoption, write documentations & guides)



Requirements


University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a similar discipline
Strong organizational, communicational and documentation skills
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong team player
English is a must


Experience Desirable


SQL knowledge is an advantage
Knowledge of ETL design principles is a plus
Knowledge or previous experience in solution design



Benefits


Private medical insurance 
Training on market trends and client needs 
Continuous personal improvement - 8h/month during work hours 
Lunch on Friday (twice per month, we pay)
21 days annual leave, with one day per year extra up to 25 days 
3 days sick leave without medical proof off
1 day for your Birthday off 
0.5 days Christmas Shopping off 
Competitive salary package
Quarterly fun budget for team events

Title: Data Analyst Jr
Description:
¿Estás preparado para un cambio y explotar tus habilidades como nunca? 👉🏼 Sigue leyendo porque tenemos lo que buscas…




🛸 ¿Quiénes somos? 🛸




Somos una empresa internacional con más de 16 años de experiencia en consultoría e ingeniería informática.




Con más de 3000 Primers operando en 4 sectores principales en todo el mundo: IT, Telecomunicaciones, Infraestructuras y Energía.




Nos puedes encontrar en más de 50 ciudades en todo el mundo:




ESPAÑA | PORTUGAL | FRANCIA | REINO UNIDO | ITALIA | SUIZA | POLONIA | BRASIL







🕵🏽‍♂️ ¿Qué buscamos? 🕵🏽‍♂️




Licenciatura en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Economía, Informática o áreas afines.
Experiencia de 1 año como Data Analyst o en roles similares.
Fuertes habilidades en SQL para consultas y manipulación de bases de datos.
Dominio en lenguajes de programación para análisis de datos, como Python o R.
Conocimiento avanzado de Excel y experiencia en el uso de Power BI o Tableau para la visualización de datos.
Familiaridad con bases de datos relacionales (PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc.).







¡¡Y lo más importante de todo que realmente estés motivado para un cambio!!




🚀 ¿Qué ofrecemos? 🚀




Podemos asegurarte que contamos con el mejor equipo de todo el sector. Desde el proceso de selección, tu incorporación y hasta nuestro desarrollo profesional te ofrecemos

un acompañamiento y un seguimiento personalizado en todo momento. Y a todo esto súmale transparencia total en todos los pasos. Pinta bien, ¿verdad?




Estamos seguros de que ya sabes qué es lo que muchas empresas te ofrecen y como nosotros estamos a la altura:




· Vas a contar con un plan de carrera, crecimiento, proyección y desarrollo profesional personalizado

· Tendrás acceso a formación continua para que puedas estar al día.

· Podrás participar en proyectos nacionales e internacionales con opción a movilidad.

· No todo va a ser trabajar, por eso disfrutar de la tarjeta restaurante y seguro médico nos parece esencial.




¡¡¡Teambuildings, afterworks y muchas más sorpresas!!!




¡Te esperamos!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Per importante Azienda Cliente, partner Microsoft che opera principalmente sul mondo Dynamics/Business Central, ricerchiamo:




n°1 JUNIOR DATA ANALYST




La persona, dopo opportuna formazione, si occuperà di analisi e implementazioni tramite Power BI. Le competenze saranno estese con un corso specifico in ambito Microsoft DAX.




Requisiti:

- Titolo di studio in ambito matematico/statistico;

- Conoscenza strumenti di analisi (es. R, Python);

- Competenze base con i database per la manipolazione dei dati.




Sede lavoro: Marcon (VE) + Smart Working

Orario: 08.30-12.30 - 14.00-18.00




Contratto: full time – iniziale tempo determinato con scopo assunzione a tempo indeterminato – RAL 22/26K

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Shiji Group is a major software supplier in the hospitality and retail industries. Developing worldwide leading products and technologies, aimed at the international market and speeding up its globalization progress. Our team of more than 5,000 talented employees, in 70+ subsidiaries worldwide, is constantly adapting to facilitate the transition to fully integrated systems for our clients through a network of secure, scalable, and ready for the future platforms, so clients can focus on their core competencies of serving their customer and guests.




Job Description



We are expanding our team, and are currently looking for a proactive and detail oriented Data Analyst, to contribute to our international growth. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and management, be comfortable with technology / SaaS Business Intelligence Tools, and is motivated by the opportunity to develop new ways to ensure a 100% data delivery & quality with the least effort possible.





Reporting to the Director of Product & Operations, the responsibilities include:


Perform data analysis and special reports for key clients, marketing and sales to identify data-driven trends and understand what matters and why.
Prepare excellent presentations, and consultancy documents to be delivered to clients.
Prioritize projects and the special data reporting pipeline and delivery times.
Execute, build and maintain data projects using Python, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio and some other data analysis tools like SPSS.
Structure, organize and maintain masses of information from different DBs to efficiently deliver on time the projects in pipeline.
Collaborate with the product managers to develop new visualizations, CRM data analysis and special data projects.


Qualifications



Candidates must be motivated, proactive and responsible individuals with:


Highly analytical mind.
Advanced Excel user.
Advanced Python user.
Experience managing the main Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Experience with advanced statistical methodology with knowledge in Python.
Desirable Knowledge in managing data through MySQL and API connections.
Results oriented.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the Task / Projects.
Desirable knowledge in the Hotels sector and online reputation.




Requirements:


Excellent level of English. (Spanish desired).
Degree or being studying information technology, business administration, engineering or mathematical sciences.


Additional Information


Flexible work schedule
Free coffee, tea, and afterwork drinks
Brand new office located in the center of Barcelona
International team and fantastic work environment
Team building activities and charity donation programs
Discounts on Private health insurance, ticket restaurant, transport, kindergarten
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

Uber is looking for Data Analysts to expand its new Team in Krakow.

The Krakow Center of Excellence is taking a new highway to become a major Technology Hub in Central & Eastern Europe, focusing on Process Optimization, Data Analytics & Automation.

After creating queries and dashboards, you will proceed to significant data analyses in order to provide insightful recommendations to Stakeholders, valuable inputs for strategic decisions.

As Data Analyst, you will work together with other Team Members: Process Optimization Specialists and Automation Specialists.

This is a great opportunity if you want to further develop your analytical skills, build sophisticated dashboards, use tools such as Data Studio, Google Sheets or Tableau and create actionable insights for large-scale operations, with concrete impacts.

About The Team

Backing Uber's creativity with operational efficiency. This is the Team's mission statement.

In essence, the Team helps Uber to scale and best serve its users by performing work around two main pillars i) Analytics & Automation - data science, data analysis, query & dashboard creation, automation of business process, ii) Process - design, execution & optimization of business processes.

Located in Krakow, the Team is centralizing work for Uber Rides & Uber Eats, covering two mega-regions, i) United States & Canada, ii) Europe, Middle East, and Africa.

This experience gained as Data Analyst may also, going forward, open doors to plenty of new opportunities across the world, via the Uber Mobility Program.

We're offering a hybrid model of working (50% based out of our Krakow office, 50% work from home).

What You Will Do


Analyze data, identify trends and build meaningful recommendations
Present your results in a concise manner to international Stakeholders
Design, lead & execute projects independently or in coordination with peers
Conduct root cause analyses, build dashboards, prepare data-driven proposals


What you will need


Knowledges in SQL, Google Sheets
Analytical and data-driven approach for solving problems
Ability to work independently, on your own initiative
Motivation to learn all along the way and improve continuously
Excellent written and spoken Communication (in English)
Show more

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attività: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualità, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilità e la sostenibilità al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica è molto più che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.




Siamo alla ricerca, per una Società del Gruppo, di un profilo di HR Data Analyst, che entrerà a far parte del Dipartimento Human Resources & Organization.




Principali attività:

Elaborazione periodica degli analytics HR consolidati (per tutte le entità legali del Gruppo)
Gestione end-to-end delle attività di reporting e controlling: dalla raccolta dati all’analisi dei trend
Predisposizione del Budget HR e del costo del personale, e relative analisi di scostamento
Monitoraggio dei KPI HR in coordinamento con le Direzioni (es. monitoraggio ferie, attrition)
Presentazione dei dati analizzati
Garantire standard per data quality e consistency
Supporto ai progetti di HRIS




Requisiti:

Laurea Magistrale, preferibilmente in materie STEM
Un Master in risorse umane sarà considerato un plus
Richiesta pregressa esperienza di 3 anni in posizioni analoghe in Società di Consulenza o in società complesse
Conoscenza base di gestionali HR (Workday e Zucchetti saranno considerati un plus)
Conoscenza avanzata di Excel e Powerpoint
Inglese livello minimo B2
Ottime capacità analitiche
Precisione ed accuratezza
Riservatezza ed affidabilità




Cosa troverai in Lottomatica:

Opportunità di lavorare nella più grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle più grandi al mondo;
Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove;
Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti;
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalità e responsabilità attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica;
Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversità, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri;
Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG;
Eccellenti opportunità di crescita.




Cosa offriamo:

Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunità di lavoro ibrido;
Ticket restaurant;
Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills;
Stipendio annuo lordo commisurato all'esperienza (da 32k a 40k)
Job Grade: 2




Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunità e promuove diversità e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione.

In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinchè il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, età, etnia, nazionalità, disabilità, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.




*****




We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.




We are looking for a HR Data Analyst profile for a Group Company, who will join the Human Resources & Organization Department.




Main activities:




Periodic processing of consolidated HR analytics (for all legal entities of the Group)
End-to-end management of reporting and controlling activities: from data collection to trend analysis
Preparation of HR and personnel cost budgets and related variance analyses
Monitoring of HR KPIs in coordination with Management (e.g. holiday monitoring, attrition)
Presentation of analysed data
Ensuring standards for data quality and consistency
Supporting HRIS projects




Requirements:

Master's degree, preferably in STEM subjects
A Master's degree in Human Resources will be considered a plus
Previous experience of 3 years in similar positions in Consultancy or complex companies required
Basic knowledge of HR management software (Workday and Zucchetti will be considered a plus)
Advanced knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint
English level at least B2
Excellent analytical skills
Accuracy and precision
Confidentiality and reliability




What you will find in Lottomatica

Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world;
Work in a very dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones;
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees;
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica;
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars;
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment;
Excellent growth opportunities.




What we offer:

Permanent contract and hybrid job opportunities;
Ticket restaurant;
Ongoing training on hard skills and soft skills;
Gross annual salary commensurate with experience (32k to 40k)
Job Grade: 2




Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination.




At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment.




We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

Show more

Title: Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London

• Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training

• Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit

• An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Analyze assets including commercial real estate loans, residential mortgages, auto loans and other cash-flow generating assets

• Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for fundings

• Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems

• Provide senior management with monthly, quarterly and annual updates on the lending portfolio

• Conduct market and asset level research




You have:




• BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)

• 0-3 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm

• Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)

• Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset

• Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English




Team profile:




Morgan Stanley FID Deleverage and Lending group (“DLG”) is seeking to hire an analyst to be part of its lending portfolio management platform based in Budapest.

DLG provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.




About Morgan Stanley




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Ona estamos buscando a un/a Junior Data Analyst para nuestro departamento de Revenue.




¡Estamos en plena expansión y crecimiento!




¿Qué nos diferencia? ¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Ona está creciendo muchísimo, es un momento muy bueno para entrar a formar parte de nosotros/as, crecer y construir juntos.
Contrato indefinido e incorporación inmediata.
Oportunidad de desarrollo y promoción interna.
Salario de incorporación: 24.000€ - 26.000 € (según experiencia)
Beneficios sociales: Retribución flexible Cobee, Adeslas a precio reducido, descuentos en nuestros complejos, RCI, descuentos en la plataforma ShoppyClub, entre otros.
Diferentes actividades a lo largo del año: Afterworks, evento de Navidad, etc...
Flexibilidad horaria, entrada entre 8:30 y 9:30; salida a partir de las 17:30. Viernes intensivos.




Serás una pieza fundamental y clave para este departamento, y para Ona.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?




- Mantenimiento de bases de datos (SQL Server y Azure SQL, SSAS).

- Gestión de proyectos de diseño y despliegue de sistemas de información.

- Capacidad para traducir los datos recabados en información de valor.

- Diseño de informes que puedan ayudar al departamento de Revenue en soluciones técnicas y en la toma de decisiones.

- Experiencia en la creación de dashboards y reportes interactivos.




¿Qué necesitamos de ti?




- Estudios universitarios en campos tecnológicos y TI, o Grado Superior con experiencia en el sector.

- Experiencia comprobable en desarrollo y creación de informes.

- Conocimientos en Power BI y SQL.

- Excelente capacidad de comunicación y presentación de informes.

- Trabajo en equipo y colaboración con diferentes departamentos.

- Adaptabilidad y aprendizaje continuo para mantenerse al día con las últimas tendencias tecnológicas.




Serán altamente valorados:

-Conocimientos comprobables con herramientas del entorno Microsoft Fabric / Microsoft Power Platform.

-Certificaciones en Power BI y/o SQL.

-Transact SQL o KQL.

Show more
