  • Diferentes actividades a lo largo del año: Afterworks, evento de Navidad, etc...
  • Flexibilidad horaria, entrada entre 8:30 y 9:30; salida a partir de las 17:30. Viernes intensivos.


Serás una pieza fundamental y clave para este departamento, y para Ona.


¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?


- Mantenimiento de bases de datos (SQL Server y Azure SQL, SSAS).

- Gestión de proyectos de diseño y despliegue de sistemas de información.

- Capacidad para traducir los datos recabados en información de valor.

- Diseño de informes que puedan ayudar al departamento de Revenue en soluciones técnicas y en la toma de decisiones.

- Experiencia en la creación de dashboards y reportes interactivos.


¿Qué necesitamos de ti?


- Estudios universitarios en campos tecnológicos y TI, o Grado Superior con experiencia en el sector.

- Experiencia comprobable en desarrollo y creación de informes.

- Conocimientos en Power BI y SQL.

- Excelente capacidad de comunicación y presentación de informes.

- Trabajo en equipo y colaboración con diferentes departamentos.

- Adaptabilidad y aprendizaje continuo para mantenerse al día con las últimas tendencias tecnológicas.


Serán altamente valorados:

-Conocimientos comprobables con herramientas del entorno Microsoft Fabric / Microsoft Power Platform.

-Certificaciones en Power BI y/o SQL.

-Transact SQL o KQL.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst – Insurance?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
Per Iren Ambiente S.p.A., società del Gruppo specializzata nella gestione di servizi di igiene ambientale, siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst da inserire nella Control Room della Direzione Raccolte a Reggio Emilia con il compito di collaborare nell'ambito dei processi di innovazione e digitalizzazione relativi ai servizi operativi di nettezza urbana, raccolta e smaltimento dei rifiuti.


Attività:

-Elaborazione di report e statistiche mediante l'utilizzo di strumenti di B.I.;

-Analisi di dataset specifici finalizzate all'estrazione di insights operativi, utili alla definizione degli interventi migliorativi in ottica di efficienza;

-Calcolo e messa a disposizione di key performance indicator per il monitoraggio dei risultati;

-Monitoraggio dello svolgimento dei servizi di Raccolta e Spazzamento nei vari territori con vigilanza costante degli indicatori;

-Presentazione dei risultati delle analisi effettuate tramite l'utilizzo di data visualization;

-Raccolta, gestione e disamina di tutte le informazioni pertinenti ad un processo aziendale, modellazione e rappresentazione grafica di eventi e implicazioni sul business, comunicazione e condivisione delle informazioni con gli stakeholders al fine di monitorare l'andamento e le performance delle attività;

-Ottimizzazione dei processi.

-Supporto a IT e consulenti esterni per comprendere le esigenze lato business utili al miglioramento delle applicazioni esistenti e alla progettazione di nuove soluzioni.


Competenze:

  • conoscenza di metodologie di analisi dei processi;
  • conoscenza e capacità base di utilizzo di strumenti di Business Intelligence quali Power BI, Qlik...
  • nozioni base di programmazione informatica, utilizzo di sistemi gestionali e di strumenti di reportistica;
  • buone conoscenze di matematica e statistica e correlata capacità di elaborazione, analisi ed interpretazione di dati;
  • capacità di utilizzo di tools di reporting.


Requisiti:

Titolo di studio richiesto:

  • Laurea di estrazione tecnica, preferibilmente in Ingegneria, Informatica o Economia e Commercio;
  • interesse per contesti tecnologici/digitali e sistemi complessi;
  • patente di guida di categoria B;
  • costituirà titolo preferenziale l’aver svolto precedenti esperienze nell’ambito delle aree logistica, trasporti o ciclo di gestione rifiuti.


Forma contrattuale di inserimento: apprendistato professionalizzante.


Sede: Reggio Emilia o, in subordine, Torino, con disponibilità a trasferte su territorio nazionale.


Saranno prese in considerazione esclusivamente le candidature corredate da Curriculum Vitae

I candidati ambosessi (D.lgs n. 198/2006) sono invitati a leggere l'informativa privacy ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. EU 679/2016 al seguente indirizzo:

https://irenfutura.gruppoiren.it/irenlavoraconnoi/portals/0/IREN_InformativaCV_irenfutura.pd

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math or a similar area;
  • Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools (for example Dataiku, Knime, etc.);
  • Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
  • Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
  • Good knowledge about SQL;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference “CS/Data_Analyst”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Place: Orkoien, Chartered Community of Navarre, Spain
Description:
TIMAC AGRO, perteneciente al Grupo Roullier, multinacional líder en nutrición vegetal, animal y humana, con productos diferenciados, de alta tecnología y en continua innovación, busca incorporar en su equipo de BI negocio un/a:

DATA ANALYST

En dependencia directa del Responsable de BI&CRM, la persona incorporada se encargará de analizar datos, crear y desarrollar cuadros de mandos/modelos en Power BI con el objetivo de dar soporte a las áreas MKT y Comercial de la empresa en la toma de decisiones de negocio.

Recoger y preparar datos para el análisis (muestreo, limpieza, clasificación)
Búsqueda de patrones en conjuntos de información
Preparar la visualización de los datos en Power BI para comprender rápidamente los resultados actuales y las tendencias futuras;
Formular hipótesis para mejorar determinadas métricas empresariales mediante la modificación de otros indicadores.




Requisitos

Para ello buscamos una persona con titulación universitaria en Análisis y Ciencia de Datos o similar.

Conocimientos de ETL, dominio de Excel y Power BI.

Un perfil técnico enfocado a negocio.

Con capacidad de comunicación y organizativa.

Se valorará experiencia en puesto similar.

Ofrecemos

Ofrecemos entrar a una multinacional formada por 450 trabajadores, formación inicial dentro del plan de integración, seguro médico, bono actividades deportivas y cheque restaurante además de amplias posibilidades de desarrollo en un equipo altamente eficaz.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Sabadell Digital nace para impulsar el proceso de transformación digital del banco. Para ello proporcionamos soluciones globales, apoyándonos en la última tecnología, en nuestra capacidad de innovar y en la experiencia de un equipo que nos ayuda a construir el futuro. Pero esto solo es posible gracias a personas como tu. Profesionales con alto expertise en el sector tecnológico capaces de hacer "que las cosas pasen" asegurando la máxima calidad y eficiencia.




Qué estamos buscando?




Buscamos un / una Analista de Datos para analizar, transformar y presentar los datos contenidos en las solicitudes de diferentes colectivos: operativa, productos y procesos de la Dirección de Operaciones de Cuentas, Personas y Caja de acuerdo con los procedimientos y políticas definidas, haciendo uso de las herramientas específicas para el tratamiento de datos para conseguir garantizar su fiabilidad, generar conclusiones y poner a disposición de los interesados la información clave. Ubicación: Sabadell.







Hablemos del proyecto...




Tus principales responsabilidades serían:




Obtención de datos de distintos orígenes e interlocutores para su modelado y explotación.




Analizar la información para entender el negocio, proceso o producto.




Modelar los conjuntos de datos para optimizar y organizar el acceso a la información.




Diseñar y construir informes, cuadros de mando, métricas e indicadores para obtener conclusiones sobre el negocio, proceso o producto mediante la visualización de datos.




Presentar resultados y/o conclusiones obtenidas para ayudar a tomar decisiones a los diferentes stakeholders.




Colaborar con los distintos equipos multidisciplinares para ofrecer soluciones innovadoras, facilitar el consumo y entendimiento de los datos propietarios.




- Liderar tareas y proyectos con alto grado de autonomía y calidad en la entrega.







¿Qué valoramos de tu candidatura?




Formación y Experiencia:




Carrera técnica: Ingeniería (Prioritariamente en Informática o Datos), Estadística o Matemáticas.




Conocimientos/skills:




- Al menos 3 años de experiencia en Análisis, modelado y presentación de datos. SAS (Nivel medio-avanzado) Office (Excel, Powerpoint, Acces. Nivel medio-avanzado) SQL (Nivel medio-avanzado) Gestión de proyectos (Nivel medio-avanzado)




Idiomas:




Se valorará conocimientos de inglés y catalán hablado / escrito.




Información adicional




Si estás buscando nuevos retos profesionales, esta es tu oportunidad!




Sabadell Digital está comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, orientación sexual, religión, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.




Sabadell Digital forma parte de la red de empresas con el distintivo de “Igualdad en la Empresa” otorgado por el Ministerio de Igualdad.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My retail client within the fashion e-commerce sector in Brussels are looking for an experienced data analyst to join their team. The team work on a variety of business problems ranging from sales, supply chain and planning, so there is lots of scope to grow within the business!




Responsibilities:




- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Requirements:




• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• Strong SQL skills

• Knowledge of GCP and BigQuery is a plus

• Excellent Python skills

• Experience with data visualisation is a plus




Salary Package:




• Up to €75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours

• Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)

• Meal vouchers.




You can reach me on the following:




Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

Phone: +31203997864

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
ABOUT US:




Our company:

Founded in 1981, TCL Electronics (HKSE 01070), is a leading global tech brand in display panels, TVs, home comfort and mobile devices. TCL operates its manufacturing and R&D centers worldwide and has products and services in 160 + countries.




TCL Electronics has developed specific expertise, promoting vertical integration, i.e. manufacturing of its LEDTVs from A to Z.

We are official partner of Italian National Football Team.

TCL’s slogan or signature, « The Creative Life », sets the tone.




For more information, kindly visit our website.




The Role:




TCT Mobile Italy is looking for a Data Analyst Intern to support the Company with the following

duties:

• Data Collection, gather sales-related data from multiple retailer and other databases;

• Data owner for the business Activity ledger for promo sellout and incentives;

• Periodical sales report and Database management;

• Sales Strategy Support: collaborate with sales teams and leadership to provide data-driven

insights and recommendations for optimizing sales strategies, pricing strategies, product

offerings, and market positioning;

• Market insight analysis: stay updated on industry trends, competition benchmark, best

practices related to sales analytics.




Requirements:




· Bachelor Degree or Master Degree in Economics, Finance or related fields of study;

· Good knowledge of English Language;

. Good teamwork spirit;

. Excellent knowledge in Excel and strong affinity with mats and figures.

. Proactivity and problem solving capability is requested







Does it sound like you? Then send us your resume and we will be glad to speak to you!







This announcement is aimed at both sexes, pursuant to laws 903/77 and 125/91 and to people of

all ages and all nationalities, pursuant to legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Basic Function:

The successful candidate will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting on various types of data, such as sales, marketing, operations, finance, and customer feedback. The resource will support to enhancement of the IT team in Ivrea.




Key responsibilities:

Extract, transform, and load data from various sources, such as databases from various systems, files, and APIs.
Analyze data using descriptive and inferential statistics, data visualization, and business intelligence tools.
Overseeing end-to-end process evaluation and operational excellence.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and presentations that communicate key insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
Use Qlik to develop and deploy interactive and user-friendly data applications.
Collaborate with other teams and departments to understand their data needs and provide solutions.
Contribute to the overarching Business Intelligence strategy.
Ensure data quality, accuracy, and consistency across all data sources and platforms.
Stay updated on the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in data analysis and data science.




Mandatory Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or master’s degree (or comparable qualification) in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience (3-5 years) in data analysis, data visualization, and data-driven decision making.
Strong knowledge and skills in Qlik (e.g., Qlik Sense or QlikView), including data modeling, scripting, expression writing, and dashboard development.
Proficiency in SQL and other data manipulation languages and tools.
Experience in working with various types of data, such as structured, unstructured, and semi-structured data.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts and findings to non-technical audiences.
Fluent English and Italian is a must.




Beneficial experience and requirement:

Certification or training in Qlik Sense, QlikView, or related technologies.
Knowledge or hands-on experience with other data analysis and data science tools, such as Python, R, Tableau, Power BI, or SAS.
Experience in applying machine learning, artificial intelligence, or advanced analytics techniques to data problems.
Experience in working with automotive or (discrete) manufacturing data.
Experience in creating and delivering reports and dashboards using Nprinting.




Work environment:

We offer a permanent contract, a dynamic and fast-growing business, a lean organization where you have the chance to be visible and appreciated by the top management, a global approach to people management. Availability to work on the Ivrea or Springdale Plant, in a young and fast-paced context, collaboration, and opportunities for growth.

Show more

The successful candidate will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting on various types of data, such as sales, marketing, operations, finance, and customer feedback. The resource will support to enhancement of the IT team in Ivrea.


Key responsibilities:

  • Extract, transform, and load data from various sources, such as databases from various systems, files, and APIs.
  • Analyze data using descriptive and inferential statistics, data visualization, and business intelligence tools.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are...

Our Mission is to help those in need with our out-of-this-world superpowers. Avalanche Laboratory's purpose is to be a reliable and long-term business partner to our customers offering them customized software solutions tailored for their business processes. We work on a project basis (in the EU and beyond), to this day we have already implemented over 320 projects and currently, we are working on another 45 projects. We have a wide range of clients from the financial sector, fintech, government projects, manufacturing companies etc.

What We Do

We are set up to provide our customers with end-to-end support in the process of developing software solutions:


Business need analysis, design of functional and non-functional requirements, system analysis, support for business transformation and IT/business consultancy;
User interface and experience design and development for mobile and desktop applications;
Front and back-end development in a wide range of technologies: Java, .NET, Ruby, GoLang, Oracle, Python
Complete Data Warehouse solutions from architecture, design and implementation using mainly Vertica, Oracle and Microsoft platforms
Avalanche has been the central counterparty for multiple major banking projects in the Scandinavia and Baltics, in areas such as lending automation, regulatory reporting and calculations, integrations, governance, risk and compliance, Basel II/III, Stress Testing, AML/KYC



Do you like us already? Wait until you see the role 😊

You will have an amazing opportunity to work with an experienced and constantly growing team. Your first project in Avalanche Labs will be in the Banking industry.

DO YOU HAVE...

🚀 Previous work experience in data analysis;

🚀 Data query skills (SQL);

🚀 Understanding of database modeling and design;

🚀 Database design experience.

What You'll Do...

🚀 Analyze, define and document business data requirements;

🚀 Define, manage and publish business terms, definitions and rules for data elements

🚀 Monitor and report data quality;

🚀 Analyze data quality issues' root causes and evaluate their business impact;

🚀 Resolve issues where possible, escalate where necessary, and propose improvement activities;

🚀 Test systems and data (from a business perspective) during IT System acquisition or changes.

WHY BECOME AN AVALANCHER...

⭐ This is an opportunity to work with talented teammates and shape the future of Avalanche Labs (and we have daring plans!)

⭐ Working on an international level in a fast-paced environment with professional growth opportunities

⭐ Benefit basket with additional health insurance plan, options to get the latest tech, additional vacation weeks, training, travel around Europe in a camper van, go on extreme adventures with Avalanchers, and much more!

⭐ Excellent quarterly company events and monthly themed events!

⭐ Flexible work time and hybrid or remote work arrangements and other perks.

⭐ Salary range in this position is up to 5000 eur gross based in LT

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client based in Westmeath is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join the team on a perm basis. The Data Analyst will be working in areas such as Big Data, Machine Learning and AI. You will work at the forefront of Data Analytics development, using the latest technologies and tools to build for their ground breaking solutions.




Job Responsibilities

Experienced and independent subject matter expert, capable of working on own initiative whilst delivering best practice solutions that deliver the strategic objectives.
Excellent problem solving skills
Strong quantitative analysis skills and experience in developing calculations to interpret and assess data sets to produce insight




Experience Required

Have a min of 5 years data analysis & reporting experience
Can demonstrate an ability to identify insights and report those insight’s to stakeholders.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience in data querying, data mining, data segmentation.
Strong understanding of Business Intelligence strategies/design as it relates to Data analysis.
2+ years experience using statistical analysis languages (R, Python, etc.).




Essential and Desirable Skills

Financial Services




Educational Requirements

Relevant Degree




Working Hours & Benefits

38 Hour Working Week
Pension
Healthcare
Bonus

Show more

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities




Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling




Requirements




Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
Excellent Excel skills
Advanced SQL skills
Good Power Query skills
Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
Strong spoken and written English

Show more
HTML:
Responsibilities


  • Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
  • Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
  • Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
  • Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
  • Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
  • Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
  • Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
  • In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling


Requirements


  • Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
  • Excellent Excel skills
  • Advanced SQL skills
  • Good Power Query skills
  • Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
  • Strong spoken and written English

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Accelerate your development and exposure to high performance applications and cloud infrastructure. Join Faptic Technology, a fast-growing scale-up organization with an ambition to be recognized as one of the leading technology companies in Romania.

Our global client base needs builders: engineers and developers who love technology, have deep expertise in software and cloud technologies, and importantly, have a passion for culture and customers.


We obsess about our customers
We build outstanding technical solutions
We create an awesome culture
We accelerate learning and careers


As a Junior Data Analyst, you will join a team who deals with cutting-edge technologies every day and strives to utilize integration services to their limits. You will be taking part in Solution and Architectural designs as well as introducing and proposing new methods and technologies through well tested Proof-of-Concepts. You will Design, develop and deploy pipelines, create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications. You will develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues.

Your activities will include:


Will be working with SQL databases
You will be mentored and have support in further learning and developing your technical skills
Analyze and translate functional specifications /user stories into technical specifications
Research and introduce new technologies and solutions
Implement Proof of Concepts and drive solutions through their full life-cycle
Design, develop and deploy pipelines
Create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications
Develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues
Participate in defining policies & procedures (cloud adoption, write documentations & guides)



Requirements


University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a similar discipline
Strong organizational, communicational and documentation skills
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong team player
English is a must


Experience Desirable


SQL knowledge is an advantage
Knowledge of ETL design principles is a plus
Knowledge or previous experience in solution design



Benefits


Private medical insurance 
Training on market trends and client needs 
Continuous personal improvement - 8h/month during work hours 
Lunch on Friday (twice per month, we pay)
21 days annual leave, with one day per year extra up to 25 days 
3 days sick leave without medical proof off
1 day for your Birthday off 
0.5 days Christmas Shopping off 
Competitive salary package
Quarterly fun budget for team events 
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Como Business Data Analyst (SQL + PowerBI) te integrarás dentro del equipo Digital Data en el área de Ecommerce de Massimo Dutti.




Buscamos personas proactivas, con capacidad para trabajar en equipo y excelentes habilidades técnicas, así como una fuerte orientación a resultados y comprensión estratégica del negocio.




Tus responsabilidades:

Junto con el departamento, definición y cálculo de KPIs avanzados que permitan evaluar el buen performance de las diferentes áreas de negocio.
Extracción, procesamiento y organización de datos. (SQL, Phyton, Snowflake, Big Query).
Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI, destinados a las demás áreas de negocio que consuman la información.
Participar en la elaboración de informes estratégicos.
Interpretación y lectura de los informes siendo capaz de construir insights relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos y transmitirla de forma eficiente a las diferentes áreas del negocio.
Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Business Analysts, Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.




Formación

Formación superior en Ingeniería, ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar.
Valorable Máster en Data Analytics o Data Science.




Experiencia Laboral

Experiencia de al menos 5 años como Data Analyst en entornos digitales, preferiblemente Ecommerce.
Amplia experiencia con bases de datos, SQL y Python.
Habilidad para entender y crear soluciones técnicas utilizando diferentes tecnologías.
Habilidades solidas en visualización de datos en Power BI.
Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos y machine learning.




Skills Tecnológicas

Nivel expert en SQL y Phyton.
Nivel avanzado de PowerBi y Excel.
Muy valorable experiencia en Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Big Query, Snowflake y familiarización con productos de la suite de Google.




Skills comunicativas y personales

Habilidades comunicativas tanto en Español como en Inglés.
Fuerte visión de negocio y de cómo el dato puede ser el motor del cambio en las decisiones estratégicas de la compañía.
Habilidad para trabajar de forma autónoma como integrante de un equipo.
Mentalidad orientada a resultados y a resolución de problemas complejos.
Atención al detalle, garantizando precisión e integridad en todos los análisis.
Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
Interés por el mundo de la moda.




Qué te ofrecemos

Dispondrás de un servicio de comedor subvencionado.
Disfrutarás de un gimnasio en nuestras instalaciones, además de clases dirigidas.
Servicio de autobús-empresa subvencionado con salida desde diferentes puntos de Barcelona, Mataró, Vallés.
InLife, un club para acercarte productos y servicios a nuestras oficinas (farmacia, mensajería etc.).
Siendo parte del grupo Inditex podrás comprar en cualquiera de nuestras marcas, con un 25% de descuento.




Massimo Dutti es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Jr
Description:
¿Estás preparado para un cambio y explotar tus habilidades como nunca? 👉🏼 Sigue leyendo porque tenemos lo que buscas…




🛸 ¿Quiénes somos? 🛸




Somos una empresa internacional con más de 16 años de experiencia en consultoría e ingeniería informática.




Con más de 3000 Primers operando en 4 sectores principales en todo el mundo: IT, Telecomunicaciones, Infraestructuras y Energía.




Nos puedes encontrar en más de 50 ciudades en todo el mundo:




ESPAÑA | PORTUGAL | FRANCIA | REINO UNIDO | ITALIA | SUIZA | POLONIA | BRASIL







🕵🏽‍♂️ ¿Qué buscamos? 🕵🏽‍♂️




Licenciatura en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Economía, Informática o áreas afines.
Experiencia de 1 año como Data Analyst o en roles similares.
Fuertes habilidades en SQL para consultas y manipulación de bases de datos.
Dominio en lenguajes de programación para análisis de datos, como Python o R.
Conocimiento avanzado de Excel y experiencia en el uso de Power BI o Tableau para la visualización de datos.
Familiaridad con bases de datos relacionales (PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc.).







¡¡Y lo más importante de todo que realmente estés motivado para un cambio!!




🚀 ¿Qué ofrecemos? 🚀




Podemos asegurarte que contamos con el mejor equipo de todo el sector. Desde el proceso de selección, tu incorporación y hasta nuestro desarrollo profesional te ofrecemos

un acompañamiento y un seguimiento personalizado en todo momento. Y a todo esto súmale transparencia total en todos los pasos. Pinta bien, ¿verdad?




Estamos seguros de que ya sabes qué es lo que muchas empresas te ofrecen y como nosotros estamos a la altura:




· Vas a contar con un plan de carrera, crecimiento, proyección y desarrollo profesional personalizado

· Tendrás acceso a formación continua para que puedas estar al día.

· Podrás participar en proyectos nacionales e internacionales con opción a movilidad.

· No todo va a ser trabajar, por eso disfrutar de la tarjeta restaurante y seguro médico nos parece esencial.




¡¡¡Teambuildings, afterworks y muchas más sorpresas!!!




¡Te esperamos!

Show more

Title: Analista (m/h/x) de datos junior (Excel, SQL y PowerBi)
Description:
¿Te consideras una persona analítica? ¿Te gusta trabajar con datos? ¿Buscas un nuevo proyecto en un ambiente favorable y motivador en una empresa líder en el sector energético? Si tu respuesta es afirmativa, ¡continúa leyendo!

MANPOWERGROUP incorpora perfil Técnico (m/h/x) análisis de datos y reporting para una importante empresa del sector energético.

¿QUÉ HARÁS?

Refuerzo actividad en el envío de ofertas a Sistemas. Soporte al equipo B2CPyP en la actividad de B2C

Refuerzo actividad de ofertas a Sistemas:

Apoyo en el cálculo de precios para las ofertas de B2C
Preparación de plantillas con el detalle de las ofertas a cargar en Sistemas
Revisión correcta implantación de las ofertas en Sistemas

Soporte actividad B2C:

Soporte en la elaboración de las ofertas para B2C
Preparación de informes de seguimiento de contratación
Apoyo en la interlocución con el Área de Marketing




¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?

· Contrato: indefinido a través de Manpower

· Jornada completa

· Horario: L – V de 9h-18h

· Salario 26.000€ b/a

· Zona: Madrid

REQUISITOS:

Grado / Licenciatura en Empresariales, Economía, Matemáticas, Administración de Empresas; Ingeniería Industrial, de la Energía o Informática. Valorables otras titulaciones si cumplen con todos los requisitos de conocimiento y experiencia.




Se valorará conocimiento en el sector energético, mercados eléctricos y formación del precio de la energía.




Nivel avanzado en paquete Office, especialmente de Excel.

Conocimiento básico de bases de datos (elaboración de consultas sencillas en SQL).

Se valorarán conocimientos en PowerBI.

Persona con carácter comunicativo y abierto.




Si estás en búsqueda y cuentas con experiencia ¡no dudes en inscribirte! BUSCAMOS EL TALENTO Y LA MOTIVACIÓN ¡TE BUSCAMOS A TI!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Per importante Azienda Cliente, partner Microsoft che opera principalmente sul mondo Dynamics/Business Central, ricerchiamo:




n°1 JUNIOR DATA ANALYST




La persona, dopo opportuna formazione, si occuperà di analisi e implementazioni tramite Power BI. Le competenze saranno estese con un corso specifico in ambito Microsoft DAX.




Requisiti:

- Titolo di studio in ambito matematico/statistico;

- Conoscenza strumenti di analisi (es. R, Python);

- Competenze base con i database per la manipolazione dei dati.




Sede lavoro: Marcon (VE) + Smart Working

Orario: 08.30-12.30 - 14.00-18.00




Contratto: full time – iniziale tempo determinato con scopo assunzione a tempo indeterminato – RAL 22/26K




Il presente annuncio è rivolto a candidati di entrambi i sessi, i quali possono consultare l'informativa sul trattamento dei dati personali (art. 13 del Reg. UE 2016/679) su www.umana.it/privacy. Umana S.p.A. è un'Agenzia per il Lavoro - Aut. Min. Lav. Prot. n. 1181 - SG del 13/12/2004.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Shiji Group is a major software supplier in the hospitality and retail industries. Developing worldwide leading products and technologies, aimed at the international market and speeding up its globalization progress. Our team of more than 5,000 talented employees, in 70+ subsidiaries worldwide, is constantly adapting to facilitate the transition to fully integrated systems for our clients through a network of secure, scalable, and ready for the future platforms, so clients can focus on their core competencies of serving their customer and guests.




Job Description



We are expanding our team, and are currently looking for a proactive and detail oriented Data Analyst, to contribute to our international growth. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and management, be comfortable with technology / SaaS Business Intelligence Tools, and is motivated by the opportunity to develop new ways to ensure a 100% data delivery & quality with the least effort possible.





Reporting to the Director of Product & Operations, the responsibilities include:


Perform data analysis and special reports for key clients, marketing and sales to identify data-driven trends and understand what matters and why.
Prepare excellent presentations, and consultancy documents to be delivered to clients.
Prioritize projects and the special data reporting pipeline and delivery times.
Execute, build and maintain data projects using Python, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio and some other data analysis tools like SPSS.
Structure, organize and maintain masses of information from different DBs to efficiently deliver on time the projects in pipeline.
Collaborate with the product managers to develop new visualizations, CRM data analysis and special data projects.


Qualifications



Candidates must be motivated, proactive and responsible individuals with:


Highly analytical mind.
Advanced Excel user.
Advanced Python user.
Experience managing the main Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Experience with advanced statistical methodology with knowledge in Python.
Desirable Knowledge in managing data through MySQL and API connections.
Results oriented.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the Task / Projects.
Desirable knowledge in the Hotels sector and online reputation.




Requirements:


Excellent level of English. (Spanish desired).
Degree or being studying information technology, business administration, engineering or mathematical sciences.


Additional Information


Flexible work schedule
Free coffee, tea, and afterwork drinks
Brand new office located in the center of Barcelona
International team and fantastic work environment
Team building activities and charity donation programs
Discounts on Private health insurance, ticket restaurant, transport, kindergarten
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My retail client within the fashion e-commerce sector in Brussels are looking for an experienced data analyst to join their team. The team work on a variety of business problems ranging from sales, supply chain and planning, so there is lots of scope to grow within the business!




Responsibilities:




- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Requirements:




• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• Strong SQL skills

• Knowledge of GCP and BigQuery is a plus

• Excellent Python skills

• Experience with data visualisation is a plus




Salary Package:




• Up to €75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours

• Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)

• Meal vouchers.




You can reach me on the following:




Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

Phone: +31203997864

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
ABOUT US:




Our company:

Founded in 1981, TCL Electronics (HKSE 01070), is a leading global tech brand in display panels, TVs, home comfort and mobile devices. TCL operates its manufacturing and R&D centers worldwide and has products and services in 160 + countries.




TCL Electronics has developed specific expertise, promoting vertical integration, i.e. manufacturing of its LEDTVs from A to Z.

We are official partner of Italian National Football Team.

TCL’s slogan or signature, « The Creative Life », sets the tone.




For more information, kindly visit our website.




The Role:




TCT Mobile Italy is looking for a Data Analyst Intern to support the Company with the following

duties:

• Data Collection, gather sales-related data from multiple retailer and other databases;

• Data owner for the business Activity ledger for promo sellout and incentives;

• Periodical sales report and Database management;

• Sales Strategy Support: collaborate with sales teams and leadership to provide data-driven

insights and recommendations for optimizing sales strategies, pricing strategies, product

offerings, and market positioning;

• Market insight analysis: stay updated on industry trends, competition benchmark, best

practices related to sales analytics.




Requirements:




· Bachelor Degree or Master Degree in Economics, Finance or related fields of study;

· Good knowledge of English Language;

. Good teamwork spirit;

. Excellent knowledge in Excel and strong affinity with mats and figures.

. Proactivity and problem solving capability is requested







Does it sound like you? Then send us your resume and we will be glad to speak to you!







This announcement is aimed at both sexes, pursuant to laws 903/77 and 125/91 and to people of

all ages and all nationalities, pursuant to legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us:

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.







Job Title - Data Analyst

Location : Copenhagen, Denmark

Joining - Immediate Joiner

Working Model - Hybrid (2 days work from office)

Detailed description of work task to be carried out

Work as an IT analyst Designer , Data Modeler and Data Analyst
Minimum 10 years of experience
Strong in SQL
Understanding business requirements and converting them to IT requirements
Participating conducting meetings with business BA or framework SME to capture requirements
Performing data and object level analysis for identifying IT solution More
Ability to write SQL Queries back track data
Description of knowledge and experience
Previous experience of banking and financial regulatory framework data models would be a huge plus
Experience of data analysis and modelling
Hands on experience of advanced SQL for query execution
Experience of Scrum Agile methodologies
Ability to understand data warehouse architecture
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical design for development
Ability to understand data models from both business and technical perspective Logic Physical Symantec Layer
Ability to understand technology and technical perspectives RDMS Teradata Snowflake
Understanding of regulatory frameworks such as FINREP COREP etc
Experience and knowledge of financial regulatory reporting and data attributes
Ability to communicate effectively with both business stakeholders and IT experts
Supporting testers in root cause analysis of incidents

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role - Data Analyst




Location - Amsterdam, Netherlandss




Job Description:




Your competencies and experience

• A master’s degree in the field of analytics, mathematics or econometrics

• You have experience with querying languages (e.g., SQL, SAS), and preferably also with dashboarding tools (e.g., Cognos, PowerBI)

• You are analytically strong and have experience in making analyses and sharing results with impact

• You are able to transform data into insights, and present them in an understandable way

• You have a can-do mentality, and you like to quickly learn and apply new techniques

• You are customer-oriented and have experience in using customer and other data to substantiate your decisions

• You can manage stakeholders at different levels, including data oriented and business experts

• You actively ask for help and feedback and you dare to give feedback

Experience with the agile way of working is beneficial for this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Adlook is a leading ad tech company, pioneering in programmatic advertising with our cutting-edge technology. As part of the RTB House group with over 1500 employees globally, we focus on innovative and future-proof solutions. By becoming a part of Adlook, you'll be entrusted with analytical responsibilities spanning diverse global markets. Your contributions will extend to large-scale projects focused on leveraging data to enhance performance understanding and streamline internal processes through automation. This role holds pivotal importance in an environment where success hinges on delivering precise insights and grasping critical performance metrics, particularly as Adlook undergoes substantial growth. Responsibilities:


Utilize SQL and/or Python to perform in-depth analysis using databases like Google Big Query
Assist local teams in achieving outstanding outcomes by offering insights and recommendations
Design, execute, and report on A/B testing and Brand Lift studies
Develop and maintain customized reporting and dashboards using tools like Tableau, Looker Studio, or similar platforms
Collaborate closely with Sales and Platform Managers to deliver exceptional Analytics service to clients
Aid Sales in establishing test protocols for client projects
Conduct meta-analysis across campaigns to extract insights regarding campaign performance and user behavior
Propose and implement processes to enhance the efficiency of internal workflows



Requirements:


1-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in roles involving data analytics, focused on deriving insights and generating reports from real-world data
Proficiency in technical skills, including intermediate-level SQL and/or basic-intermediate Python coding necessary for data analysis. Proficiency in SQL is essential for utilizing BigQuery effectively
Ability to frame unstructured problems using available data, coupled with skills in visualizing and communicating results. Proficiency in traditional office applications like Excel and PowerPoint (or their Google Suite equivalents) is required
Understanding of basic statistics and hypothesis testing, including A/B testing and statistical significance
Familiarity with online media and/or e-commerce, encompassing expertise in web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe), digital media sales models (CPM, CPC, CPA), and analysis of on-site user behavior
Fluent in English with the ability to present findings in a pedagogue manner
Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (or non-quantitative field with significant quantitative experience). A Master’s Degree or certifications in analytics, data science, or digital media/marketing are advantageous but not mandatory
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, or Looker Studio
Location- Poland



Why Adlook:


Be part of a company shaping the future of digital marketing
Impactful role in a strategic entity of the Adlook group
Flexible working arrangements
Exposure to a fast-paced and growing online advertising sector
Work in a truly international environment with a dynamic, open-minded team



What We Offer:


Ability to join a young and fast-growing global organization with offices across EMEA, US and LATAM
You will get to work with amazing people in one of the fastest growing sectors in online advertising
Opportunity to work in a truly international environment
Friendly atmosphere while working with a dynamic team of open minded professionals with passion for internet technology and advertising solutions
Opportunities for professional growth
Competitive compensation and benefits

Show more

As part of the RTB House group with over 1500 employees globally, we focus on innovative and future-proof solutions. By becoming a part of Adlook, you'll be entrusted with analytical responsibilities spanning diverse global markets. Your contributions will extend to large-scale projects focused on leveraging data to enhance performance understanding and streamline internal processes through automation. This role holds pivotal importance in an environment where success hinges on delivering precise insights and grasping critical performance metrics, particularly as Adlook undergoes substantial growth. Responsibilities:

  • Utilize SQL and/or Python to perform in-depth analysis using databases like Google Big Query
  • Assist local teams in achieving outstanding outcomes by offering insights and recommendations
  • Design, execute, and report on A/B testing and Brand Lift studies
  • Develop and maintain customized reporting and dashboards using tools like Tableau, Looker Studio, or similar platforms
  • Collaborate closely with Sales and Platform Managers to deliver exceptional Analytics service to clients
  • Aid Sales in establishing test protocols for client projects
  • Conduct meta-analysis across campaigns to extract insights regarding campaign performance and user behavior
  • Propose and implement processes to enhance the efficiency of internal workflows


Requirements:

  • 1-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in roles involving data analytics, focused on deriving insights and generating reports from real-world data
  • Proficiency in technical skills, including intermediate-level SQL and/or basic-intermediate Python coding necessary for data analysis. Proficiency in SQL is essential for utilizing BigQuery effectively
  • Ability to frame unstructured problems using available data, coupled with skills in visualizing and communicating results. Proficiency in traditional office applications like Excel and PowerPoint (or their Google Suite equivalents) is required
  • Understanding of basic statistics and hypothesis testing, including A/B testing and statistical significance
  • Familiarity with online media and/or e-commerce, encompassing expertise in web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe), digital media sales models (CPM, CPC, CPA), and analysis of on-site user behavior
  • Fluent in English with the ability to present findings in a pedagogue manner

  • Be part of a company shaping the future of digital marketing

  • Opportunity to work in a truly international environment
  • Friendly atmosphere while working with a dynamic team of open minded professionals with passion for internet technology and advertising solutions
  • Opportunities for professional growth
  • Competitive compensation and benefits

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Europa Factor S.p.A. intermediario finanziario vigilato da Banca d’Italia, tra i leader nell'acquisto e gestione di crediti NPL nel mercato italiano, è alla ricerca di un Data Analyst.


Se sei un Data Analyst con comprovata esperienza nel settore, inviaci la tua candidatura.


Requisiti:

  • preferibile laurea magistrale in Matematica, Economia o Ingegneria Gestionale;
  • esperienza di almeno 3 anni in contesti aziendali;
  • capacità organizzative e gestionali;
  • capacità di raccolta e organizzazione dati;
  • capacità di analisi dati;
  • ottime capacità di utilizzo strumenti Excel, SQL, Access e Power BI;


Responsabilità:

  • creazione di report operativi e dashboard direzionali;
  • gestione e controllo delle attività operative;
  • gestione dei flussi informatici per aggiornamento pratiche;
  • monitoraggio processi;
  • analisi andamenti operativi;
  • supporto strategie direzionali.


I dettagli sui piani retributivi, il percorso di crescita e le opportunità di formazione continua saranno presentati durante il colloquio conoscitivo.


Unisciti a Europa Factor S.p.A. e porta la tua competenza al servizio dell'eccellenza nella gestione dei crediti.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Basic Function:

The successful candidate will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting on various types of data, such as sales, marketing, operations, finance, and customer feedback. The resource will support to enhancement of the IT team in Ivrea.




Key responsibilities:

Extract, transform, and load data from various sources, such as databases from various systems, files, and APIs.
Analyze data using descriptive and inferential statistics, data visualization, and business intelligence tools.
Overseeing end-to-end process evaluation and operational excellence.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and presentations that communicate key insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
Use Qlik to develop and deploy interactive and user-friendly data applications.
Collaborate with other teams and departments to understand their data needs and provide solutions.
Contribute to the overarching Business Intelligence strategy.
Ensure data quality, accuracy, and consistency across all data sources and platforms.
Stay updated on the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in data analysis and data science.




Mandatory Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or master’s degree (or comparable qualification) in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience (3-5 years) in data analysis, data visualization, and data-driven decision making.
Strong knowledge and skills in Qlik (e.g., Qlik Sense or QlikView), including data modeling, scripting, expression writing, and dashboard development.
Proficiency in SQL and other data manipulation languages and tools.
Experience in working with various types of data, such as structured, unstructured, and semi-structured data.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts and findings to non-technical audiences.
Fluent English and Italian is a must.




Beneficial experience and requirement:

Certification or training in Qlik Sense, QlikView, or related technologies.
Knowledge or hands-on experience with other data analysis and data science tools, such as Python, R, Tableau, Power BI, or SAS.
Experience in applying machine learning, artificial intelligence, or advanced analytics techniques to data problems.
Experience in working with automotive or (discrete) manufacturing data.
Experience in creating and delivering reports and dashboards using Nprinting.




Work environment:

We offer a permanent contract, a dynamic and fast-growing business, a lean organization where you have the chance to be visible and appreciated by the top management, a global approach to people management. Availability to work on the Ivrea or Springdale Plant, in a young and fast-paced context, collaboration, and opportunities for growth.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are...

Our Mission is to help those in need with our out-of-this-world superpowers. Avalanche Laboratory's purpose is to be a reliable and long-term business partner to our customers offering them customized software solutions tailored for their business processes. We work on a project basis (in the EU and beyond), to this day we have already implemented over 320 projects and currently, we are working on another 45 projects. We have a wide range of clients from the financial sector, fintech, government projects, manufacturing companies etc.

What We Do

We are set up to provide our customers with end-to-end support in the process of developing software solutions:


Business need analysis, design of functional and non-functional requirements, system analysis, support for business transformation and IT/business consultancy;
User interface and experience design and development for mobile and desktop applications;
Front and back-end development in a wide range of technologies: Java, .NET, Ruby, GoLang, Oracle, Python
Complete Data Warehouse solutions from architecture, design and implementation using mainly Vertica, Oracle and Microsoft platforms
Avalanche has been the central counterparty for multiple major banking projects in the Scandinavia and Baltics, in areas such as lending automation, regulatory reporting and calculations, integrations, governance, risk and compliance, Basel II/III, Stress Testing, AML/KYC



Do you like us already? Wait until you see the role 😊

You will have an amazing opportunity to work with an experienced and constantly growing team. Your first project in Avalanche Labs will be in the Banking industry.

DO YOU HAVE...

🚀 Previous work experience in data analysis;

🚀 Data query skills (SQL);

🚀 Understanding of database modeling and design;

🚀 Database design experience.

What You'll Do...

🚀 Analyze, define and document business data requirements;

🚀 Define, manage and publish business terms, definitions and rules for data elements

🚀 Monitor and report data quality;

🚀 Analyze data quality issues' root causes and evaluate their business impact;

🚀 Resolve issues where possible, escalate where necessary, and propose improvement activities;

🚀 Test systems and data (from a business perspective) during IT System acquisition or changes.

WHY BECOME AN AVALANCHER...

⭐ This is an opportunity to work with talented teammates and shape the future of Avalanche Labs (and we have daring plans!)

⭐ Working on an international level in a fast-paced environment with professional growth opportunities

⭐ Benefit basket with additional health insurance plan, options to get the latest tech, additional vacation weeks, training, travel around Europe in a camper van, go on extreme adventures with Avalanchers, and much more!

⭐ Excellent quarterly company events and monthly themed events!

⭐ Flexible work time and hybrid or remote work arrangements and other perks.

⭐ Salary range in this position is up to 5000 eur gross based in LT

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client based in Westmeath is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join the team on a perm basis. The Data Analyst will be working in areas such as Big Data, Machine Learning and AI. You will work at the forefront of Data Analytics development, using the latest technologies and tools to build for their ground breaking solutions.




Job Responsibilities

Experienced and independent subject matter expert, capable of working on own initiative whilst delivering best practice solutions that deliver the strategic objectives.
Excellent problem solving skills
Strong quantitative analysis skills and experience in developing calculations to interpret and assess data sets to produce insight




Experience Required

Have a min of 5 years data analysis & reporting experience
Can demonstrate an ability to identify insights and report those insight’s to stakeholders.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience in data querying, data mining, data segmentation.
Strong understanding of Business Intelligence strategies/design as it relates to Data analysis.
2+ years experience using statistical analysis languages (R, Python, etc.).




Essential and Desirable Skills

Financial Services




Educational Requirements

Relevant Degree




Working Hours & Benefits

38 Hour Working Week
Pension
Healthcare
Bonus

Title: Junior Data Analyst - Marketing Product Development
HTML:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, deliver digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data and innovate. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Description

We are recruiting for a fundamental role within our Marketing Product Development team. The Analyst position is an important role within the department, reporting into the Analytics Manager.

What you'll do?

  • You will deliver analytical projects which will involve analysing data sets, getting to the bottom of what is going on with the data;
  • Communicate your findings to different stakeholders;
  • Blend a knowledge of mathematical, analytical or spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and analysing data.

Qualifications

What you'll bring?

Skills

We're after a team player who has a desire to deliver analysis projects to budgeted time, with accuracy, using core analytical techniques and applications. You will have an enthusiasm and determination to develop your skills. Therefore, you'll bring:

  • Mathematical competency;
  • Data analysis and interpretation skills;

The following additional skills would be advantageous but not essential:

  • Regression Modelling;
  • Segmentation;
  • Machine Learning Location analysis;

It Would Be Great If You Have Previous Experience Data Analysis And Interpretation And An Understanding Of Any Programming Languages And Applications Such As

  • R;
  • Python;
  • Spark;
  • SAS;
  • Alteryx;
  • VBA;
  • SQL;
  • Tableau, MicroStrategy or PowerBI;
  • ArcGIS, MapInfo or other GIS software;

Additional Information

What you will get:

  • Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
  • Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
  • Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
  • Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
  • Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books.

Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Primero quién




Implicado/a siempre dispuesto a ayudar a tu equipo
Trabajo en equipo: capaz de trabajar en un ambiente multicultural
Proactivo/a te gustan los proyectos que avanzan rápido y bien
Organizado/a




Después qué




Funciones principales en la misión

Diseñar y desarrollar flujos de trabajo analíticos y soluciones de apoyo.
Colaborar con las partes interesadas de la empresa para traducir los requisitos empresariales en preguntas empresariales clave
Desarrollar e implementar bases de datos, sistemas de recopilación de datos, analítica de datos y otras estrategias que optimicen la eficiencia estadística y la calidad
Garantizar la precisión e integridad de los datos en los resultados de los análisis.




Educación y Experiencia:

2 o 3 años mínimo de experiencia en un rol similar
Gran dominio de SQL y experiencia con lenguajes de programación como Python o R.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos (por ejemplo, Tableau, SpotFire).
Demostrada capacidad de comunicación eficaz tanto escrita como verbal en inglés.




Qué ofrecemos en Extia

Plan de carrera personalizado
Tickets restaurante
Seguro médico privado
Reembolso transporte público
Ambiente internacional y joven
Oficina a pocos metros de la playa
Bebidas gratis (cerveza, café, agua, té, leche)
Modalidad híbrida
Eventos (formaciones, meetups, afters, fiestas)




Todo lo que se te ocurra, ¡será bienvenido!

Title: Data Analyst - Remote (Portugal)
Description:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.




What are you going to do?

Gather, evaluate, and interpret extensive and intricate data sets from diverse sources.
Design and manage dashboards, reports, and visualizations to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Partner with stakeholders to identify opportunities for process improvements through data analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and reliability of data.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses and offer insights to guide business decisions.
Keep abreast of industry advancements and emerging trends in data analysis.




What are we looking for?

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis.
Proficient in SQL with hands-on experience in BigQuery and PostgreSQL.
Familiarity with data visualization tools, particularly Looker.
Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and analytical abilities.
Knowledge of NoSQL databases is a plus.
Written and verbal communication skills in English (B2 or above).
Availability for a Remote work model (Portugal based).




What do we have to offer you?

Health Insurance;
Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
Working model: hybrid (2 times per week in the office – Lisbon);
A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
Events and Teambuildings.




What makes us different?

Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
Reference prizes and birthday present;
Lounge;
We don’t have a dress code;
We know your name and all address each other informally;
Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
You will grow in good company. Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?




If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm.

Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you at daniela.vieira@aubay.pt!




We will use personal information that you have sent us to consider your application for the relevant function. By giving us your information/documents by email, you consent to Aubay Portugal treating your personal information. Your privacy is important to us. Please check our Privacy Policy, which explains how we will use and store your personal information. It also explains the rights you have regarding your information and how you can contact us for clarification of questions or requests.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that’s what we’re doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we’ve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our Ideal Candidate Has


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus Points


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar


What’s it like to work at Cabify?

We’re a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

⌚Hybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

💶Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-40K€]

🏝️Recharge days

🌍Our office is located in Madrid.

⌚Flexible work environment & hours.

🙌Regular team events.

🚗Cabify staff free rides.

🚀Personal development programs based on our career paths.

🧘‍♀️ iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.

📐Coursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.

💳Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare

💻All the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent).

🐱A pet room, so you don’t have to leave your furry friend at home

☕️And last but not least...free coffee and fruit!

Cabify is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

Join us!
Show more
